summary: A comprehensive math enthusiast platform and edtech website offering thinking-based mathematics and creative problem-solving using Rajat's equation, designed for learners at all levels. Platform focuses on marketing and enrollment with services display, persuasive payment section, and professional edtech design without interactive problem-solving features.
architectural_notes: Payment system should integrate with UPI (9424135055@ptyes) and track payment records without public price display
Services offered: IOQM prep, NMTC prep, thinking-based math for any standard, bridge course for JEE, JEE full course for mathematics, 'How to think in math' for struggling students
Platform repositioned as general math enthusiast edtech site, not JEE-specific
Services renamed: 'Bridge Course for JEE' → 'Mathematical Foundations Course', 'JEE Full Course' → 'Comprehensive Mathematics Program'
Platform repositioned as edtech marketing and enrollment website (not interactive learning tool)
ProblemGenerator and ProgressTracker components removed from UI
CourseOffering component hidden from visible interface
New persuasive payment section replaces CourseOffering for enrollment
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Professional Rajat's Equation logo featuring a mathematical square root symbol (√) elegantly integrated into the letter 'R', with 'THE' in serif typography above and 'RAJAT'S EQUATION' in clean serif typography below, using dark navy blue color on light cream background (rajats-equation-logo.dim_250x200.png)

existing_features.title: Create a landing page that introduces the app's purpose: thinking-based mathematics and creative math skills development using Rajat's equation
Implement a math problem generator that creates thinking-based mathematical challenges
Create an interactive problem-solving interface where users can work through math problems step-by-step
Create a user progress tracking system that stores solved problems and skill development metrics

Design a creative, engaging visual theme that makes mathematics feel approachable and inspiring, using warm earth tones (terracotta, sage green, cream) with geometric patterns and clean typography that balances academic rigor with creative exploration
Update the ProblemGenerator component to include an answer input field where students can type their complete answer and a submit button to check their work
Display validation results to students showing whether their answer is correct or incorrect, with constructive feedback and the option to try again

Update the Hero component to reflect that this app is specifically designed for JEE (Joint Entrance Examination) students, emphasizing JEE mathematics preparation alongside thinking-based mathematics and creative problem-solving using Rajat's equation

Expand the problem generator to include JEE-specific mathematics topics including calculus (limits, derivatives, integrals), algebra (complex numbers, quadratic equations, sequences and series), coordinate geometry, trigonometry, vectors, and probability, while maintaining the existing difficulty levels (easy, medium, hard)

Update the progress tracking system to categorize solved problems by JEE-relevant topics (calculus, algebra, coordinate geometry, trigonometry, vectors, probability) instead of or in addition to generic categories, showing students their strengths and areas needing improvement across the JEE syllabus

Add JEE-appropriate difficulty calibration where 'easy' problems match JEE Main level questions, 'medium' problems match competitive JEE Main questions, and 'hard' problems match JEE Advanced level complexity

Rebuild the entire application with all existing features intact, including the JEE-focused landing page, problem generator with JEE-specific topics (calculus, algebra, coordinate geometry, trigonometry, vectors, probability), answer validation system, and progress tracking by topic and difficulty
Create a CourseOffering component in the frontend that displays the full course details including title, description, benefits, and price (₹1500), with a prominent purchase button
Implement course purchase flow in the frontend where clicking the purchase button calls the backend purchaseCourse function and displays success/error feedback to the user
Add React Query hooks for course operations including useGetCourseDetails to fetch course information and usePurchaseCourse mutation to handle purchase actions
Display the CourseOffering component in the App.tsx after the Hero section, making it visible to all users before they start solving problems
Update the user profile to track course purchase status and display a badge or indicator in the UI when a user has purchased the full course

Register a service worker in frontend/src/main.tsx that enables offline functionality and allows the PWA to be installable on Windows, with caching strategy for static assets and basic offline fallback

Update frontend/index.html to include PWA meta tags (theme-color, apple-mobile-web-app-capable, apple-mobile-web-app-status-bar-style) and link to the manifest file, ensuring Windows browsers recognize the app as installable

Add an 'Install App' button or prompt in the Hero component that detects when the PWA install prompt is available and allows Windows users to install the application with a single click, using the beforeinstallprompt event
Update the ProblemGenerator component to display the complete step-by-step solution to students after they submit their answer or when they request to view the solution

Update the CourseOffering component to remove all price displays (₹2499 or ₹1500) and replace the purchase button with a UPI payment link using the UPI ID 9424135055@ptyes, formatted as upi://pay?pa=9424135055@ptyes&pn=Rajat%27s%20Equation

Create a Services component in the frontend that displays all offered services as a list: 'IOQM Prep', 'NMTC Prep', 'Thinking-Based Math for Any Standard', 'Bridge Course for JEE (Mathematics)', 'JEE Full Course for Mathematics', and 'How to Think in Math - for students facing difficulty in mathematics'
Add a WhatsApp contact link in the Footer or CourseOffering component that redirects to WhatsApp chat with phone number 9424135055, using the format https://wa.me/919424135055

Add a YouTube channel link in the Footer or Hero component that redirects to https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCR9lkyJ3JIhlSx3_e06DTEw with an external link icon or button labeled 'YouTube Channel' or 'Watch on YouTube'

Update the brand name throughout the application from 'JEE Math Mastery' or 'Rajat's Math' to 'Rajat's Equation' to match the uploaded logo, including the Hero component, Footer component, PWA manifest, and page title

Display the Services component in App.tsx after the CourseOffering component and before the ProblemGenerator, making the services list visible to all users

Update the Hero component to remove all JEE-specific messaging and replace it with welcoming content for general math enthusiasts, emphasizing mathematical thinking, problem-solving, and Rajat's equation for all learners regardless of exam focus

Update the ProblemGenerator component to remove JEE-specific difficulty level descriptions ('JEE Main level', 'JEE Advanced level') and replace them with general mathematical difficulty descriptions suitable for all math enthusiasts

Update the ProgressTracker component to remove JEE-specific language and reframe progress tracking for general mathematical learning, removing any references to 'JEE syllabus', 'JEE topics', or exam preparation

Update the Services component to rename 'Bridge Course for JEE (Mathematics)' to 'Mathematical Foundations Course' and 'JEE Full Course for Mathematics' to 'Comprehensive Mathematics Program', keeping all other services unchanged

Update the CourseOffering component to remove all JEE-specific language from the course title, description, and benefits, reframing it as a comprehensive mathematics program for all enthusiasts while maintaining the existing UPI payment integration

Update frontend/index.html page title from 'Rajat's Equation - Master JEE Mathematics' to 'Rajat's Equation - Master Mathematical Thinking' or similar general mathematics title without JEE reference

Update the Hero component (frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx) to display the generated Rajat's Equation logo image at the top of the Hero section, positioned prominently above or alongside the headline, with proper sizing (200-250px wide on desktop) and responsive behavior for mobile devices
